Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the murder rate in the United States by stating that it is the highest it has been in 45 years, which is not supported by the data.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the murder rate in the United States is not the highest it has been in 45 years, as evidenced by FBI data.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by accurate data or evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the press never talks about the murder rate in the United States, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, which is that Trump may have been referring to the one-year increase in the murder rate in 2015 compared to 2014, rather than the overall rate being the highest in 45 years.
